items.longDescription:
The design is chosen from the scene at the beginning of the "The Scarlet School Trip" episode, which depicts a school trip to Kyoto from Teitan High School where Shinichi and Ran attended. The design shows the bittersweet scene of the moment Sonoko takes a two-shot of them, while she worries about the future of Shinichi and Ran's relationship.

Introduction of Detective Conan (Case Closed)

After solving a case, high school detective Shinichi Kudo witnessed men dressed all in black engaging in suspicious activity. In an attempt to silence him, they force-fed him a mysterious drug that caused his body to shrink to that of a first grader. Gosho Aoyama's mystery manga "Detective Conan (Case Closed)", which began serialization in "Weekly Shonen Sunday" in 1994, is now a very popular manga with more than 100 volumes. This original design, featuring fan-favorite scenes and art, are available only at UNIQLO.

©Gosho Aoyama/Shogakukan

Taking inspiration from an important scene in the game, the front of the shirt features a feather from the Phoenix, Eikon of Fire, peeking from the pocket, while the back features an abstract design representing both the world of FINAL FANTASY XVI and its eight Eikons.

FINAL FANTASY

Debuting in 1987, the FINAL FANTASY series has earned worldwide acclaim for its cutting-edge visuals, distinctive world-building, and captivating storytelling. This exclusive collection seamlessly melds the art of Yoshitaka Amano—renowned for helping bring to life the series' unique worldview—alongside the iconic pixel art from the first six titles. Also featured are designs from the series’ online RPG, FFXIV, as well as its latest mainline installment, FFXVI.

© SQUARE ENIX, LOGO & IMAGE ILLUSTRATION:© YOSHITAKA AMANO

The front design is a mix of the striking number "8" in the Kaiju No. 8 logo and key visuals from the anime. The back side features a one-pointed design of the Kaiju No. 8 logo.

Kaiju No.8

The original work is a manga series by Naoya Matsumoto, currently serialized in "Shonen Jump+" (Shueisha). The highly anticipated anime adaptation will begin airing in 2024. The story is set in a world where monsters threaten people's daily lives. The T-shirt collection depicts the "Japan Anti-Kaiju Defense Force" defeating monsters, Kafka Hibino also known as Kaiju No. 8, and his friends from the dynamic storyline of the film.

Uniqlo proudly presents the World’s Premier of KAWS newest artbook (Publisher: Phaidon). Launching Together: UT exclusive collection featuring original artwork designed in conjunction with KAWS art book release. Experience the cutting-edge fusion of artbook and T-shirts combined in an exciting new way.

KAWS
KAWS engages audiences far beyond the museums and galleries in which he regularly exhibits. Over the last two decades, KAWS has built a successful career with work that consistently shows his formal agility as an artist, as well as his underlying wit, irreverence, and affection for our times. He has collaborated extensively with UNIQLO, including by providing designs for the PEACE FOR ALL charity project in 2022, which was a huge worldwide success.

© KAWS

items.longDescription:
Louvre x Camille Henrot

Camille Henrot is one of the most influential voices in contemporary art today, working in film, painting, drawing, bronze, sculpture, and installation. Henrot draws upon references from literature, psychoanalysis, social media, self help and the banality of everyday life. This collection features a personal reinterpretation of Camille's favorite artworks in the Louvre Museum through digital and analog collage and graphic interventions.

Camille Henrot
Born in 1978 in Paris (France), CAMILLE HENROT lives and works in New York City. Camille Henrot is one of the most influential voices in contemporary art today and has developed a critically acclaimed practice in film, painting, drawing, bronze, sculpture, and installation. Henrot draws upon references from literature, psychoanalysis, social media, self help and the banality of everyday life to question what it means to be both a private individual and a global citizen in an increasingly connected and over-stimulated world.

©Camille Henrot

items.longDescription:
POP SONG

The single “POP SONG” was released in 2022 as the　theme song for a PlayStation commercial. The cover　art was illustrated by Yonezu based on the　catchphrase “Play Has No Limits.” Yonezu appears　as a character in the commercial.

KENSHI YONEZU

Japanese Culture UT by Kenshi Yonezu. Wear the essence of entertainment proudly echoing from Japan throughout the world. The world full of dreams created by director Hayao Miyazaki of Studio Ghibli. The epic adventure of “FINAL FANTASY XVI”. The exciting stimulus of “CHAINSAW MAN”. The majestic presence of “Ultraman”. And the innovative appeal of PlayStation™. All captured on the canvas of UT. We present this wear with the wish that it turns your ordinary into extraordinary moments. 

Kenshi Yonezu
Singer-Songwriter and Illustrator
After gaining success with Vocaloid music under the stage name Hachi, Kenshi Yonezu began producing under his real name in 2012. In addition to music, he has attracted attention for his album cover illustrations and video productions. The video for his hit single “Lemon"" is the most-viewed music video in Japan, and topped Billboard Japan’s year-end charts for two consecutive years, leaving a mark on music history both in Japan and abroad. His 2020 album “STRAY SHEEP” set a record of two million copies sold. He continued to work tirelessly during the COVID-19 pandemic, including performing in a virtual concert hosted by the online game Fortnite, and collaborating globally with UNIQLO on their UT collection. He was awarded an AAC Award, listed in Forbes’ 100 Asian Digital Stars, and received the Minister of Education, Culture, Sports, Science and Technology's Art Encouragement Prize for New Artists. In 2022, he released “M87"" as the theme song for the film Shin Ultraman, and “POP SONG” as the theme song for a PlayStation commercial. His single “KICK BACK,” the opening theme for the TV anime Chainsaw Man, made Spotify's Global Top 50, and became the first Japanese-language song certified Gold by RIAA®. In 2023, Yonezu released “Tsuki Wo Miteita - Moongazing” as the theme song for the RPG game Final Fantasy XVI, and “Chikyugi - Spinning Globe” - the theme song Studio Ghibli’s animated film The Boy and the Heron (Academy Award Winner for Best Animated Feature, 2024), directed by Hayao Miyazaki. His latest album “LOST CORNER” will be released in August 2024.

This piece from the Marineford focuses on the theme of Luffy’s “the loss" due to the death of his beloved older brother Ace. Camille Henrot is one of the most influential voices in contemporary art today, working in film, painting, drawing, bronze, sculpture, and installation. Camille Henrot
Born in 1978 in Paris (France), CAMILLE HENROT lives and works in New York City. Camille Henrot is one of the most influential voices in contemporary art today and has developed a critically acclaimed practice in film, painting, drawing, bronze, sculpture, and installation. Henrot draws upon references from literature, psychoanalysis, social media, self help and the banality of everyday life to question what it means to be both a private individual and a global citizen in an increasingly connected and over-stimulated world.

©Camille Henrot

items.longDescription:
STRAY SHEEP

The album “STRAY SHEEP” released in 2020, includes such major hits as “Lemon,” “Paprika,” “Kanden” and “Uma to Shika. Album cover, illustrated by Yonezu himself during the COVID-19 pandemic, features prominently on the front.

KENSHI YONEZU

Japanese Culture UT by Kenshi Yonezu. Wear the essence of entertainment proudly echoing from Japan throughout the world. The world full of dreams created by director Hayao Miyazaki of Studio Ghibli. The epic adventure of “FINAL FANTASY XVI”. The exciting stimulus of “CHAINSAW MAN”. The majestic presence of “Ultraman”. And the innovative appeal of PlayStation™. All captured on the canvas of UT. We present this wear with the wish that it turns your ordinary into extraordinary moments. 

Kenshi Yonezu
Singer-Songwriter and Illustrator
After gaining success with Vocaloid music under the stage name Hachi, Kenshi Yonezu began producing under his real name in 2012. In addition to music, he has attracted attention for his album cover illustrations and video productions. The video for his hit single “Lemon"" is the most-viewed music video in Japan, and topped Billboard Japan’s year-end charts for two consecutive years, leaving a mark on music history both in Japan and abroad. His 2020 album “STRAY SHEEP” set a record of two million copies sold. He continued to work tirelessly during the COVID-19 pandemic, including performing in a virtual concert hosted by the online game Fortnite, and collaborating globally with UNIQLO on their UT collection. He was awarded an AAC Award, listed in Forbes’ 100 Asian Digital Stars, and received the Minister of Education, Culture, Sports, Science and Technology's Art Encouragement Prize for New Artists. In 2022, he released “M87"" as the theme song for the film Shin Ultraman, and “POP SONG” as the theme song for a PlayStation commercial. His single “KICK BACK,” the opening theme for the TV anime Chainsaw Man, made Spotify's Global Top 50, and became the first Japanese-language song certified Gold by RIAA®. In 2023, Yonezu released “Tsuki Wo Miteita - Moongazing” as the theme song for the RPG game Final Fantasy XVI, and “Chikyugi - Spinning Globe” - the theme song Studio Ghibli’s animated film The Boy and the Heron (Academy Award Winner for Best Animated Feature, 2024), directed by Hayao Miyazaki. His latest album “LOST CORNER” will be released in August 2024.

Our left arms will bear the sign of our fellowship!
This piece from the Alabasta is based on the theme of the bond between "friends". The series depicts the encounter with Vivi and the bond between friends during the fierce battle in the Kingdom of Alabasta ruled by Crocodile, one of the Seven Warlords of the Sea. As a princess, she chooses to live with her beloved country, but when she meets him again, she wants him to call her his friend again. Luffy and his friends respond to Vivi ’s tearful question by holding up the mark of companionship on their left arms. This is a picture of the scene where they confirmed the marks of their comrades drawn on their arms before the decisive battle.

items.longDescription:
UT ARCHIVE Andy Warhol / Keith Haring / Jean-Michel Basquiat

“UT Archive” is a project that revives carefully selected T-shirts which have been sold in the past. From the UT collection that has been on sale for about 20 years, popular patterns by Andy Warhol, Basquiat, and Keith Haring will be re-released.

Andy Warhol
As the preeminent American artist of the 20th Century, Andy Warhol challenged the world to see art differently. This product is produced under a license from The Andy Warhol Foundation for the Visual Arts, Inc., a New York not-for-profit corporation which promotes the visual arts.

Keith Haring
A key figure in New York’s East Village scene in the late 1970s and 80s, American artist Keith Haring’s artwork populated not only art galleries, but also the city’s subways, streets, and sidewalks. His work often combined an iconographic vocabulary, including hearts, flying saucers, winged figures, and a crawling “radiant baby,”with abstract marks and patterning.

Jean-Michel Basquiat
An icon of New York in the 1980s, Jean-Michel Basquiat became renowned during his short career for works inspired by his early street art and a distinctive iconography often connected to art history. His paintings, drawings, and prints drew on a diverse range of sources, from African, Aztec, and Greek cultures to Americana in the form of jazz, baseball, and social and political events.

©/®/™ The Andy Warhol Foundation for the Visual Arts, Inc.
© Keith Haring Foundation. Licensed by Artestar, New York.
© Estate of Jean-Michel Basquiat. Licensed by Artestar, New York.
